abstract.title: EPUB Publications 3.1
abstract.para: EPUB is an interchange and delivery format for digital publications based on XML and Web Standards.

chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This specification, EPUB 3.1, defines a distribution and interchange format standard for digital publications and documents. EPUB® defines a means of representing, packaging and encoding structured and semantically enhanced Web content — including HTML5, CSS, SVG and other resources — for distribution in a single-file format.

EPUB has been widely adopted as the format for digital books (eBooks), and these specifications significantly increase the format's capabilities in order to better support a wider range of publication requirements, including complex layouts, rich media and interactivity, and global typography features. The expectation is that EPUB 3 will be utilized for a broad range of content, including books, magazines and educational, professional and scientific publications.

section.title: Overview
section.para: This specification provides only a basic listing of the core and satellite EPUB 3 specifications. A more comprehensive introduction to features and functionality that EPUB 3 provides is included in the informative .
A list of changes from EPUB 3.0.1 is also provided in the informative .

section.title: Core
section.para: The EPUB 3.1 core is defined as the set of specifications that contain the essential information that Authors need to create and package EPUB Publications and that Reading System developers require to ingest them.
The core is composed of the following specifications:

listitem.para: EPUB Publications 3.1 , which defines the semantics and overarching conformance requirements for EPUB Publications, including the requirements for each of the content and the profiles of XHTML, SVG and CSS.
EPUB Media Overlays 3.1 , which defines a format and a processing model for synchronization of text and audio.
EPUB Open Container Format (OCF) 3.1 , which defines a file format and processing model for encapsulating a set of related resources into a single-file (ZIP) .

section.title: Modules
section.para: The following specifications are considered modular extensions of the EPUB 3.1 core as they layer additional functionality on EPUB Publications:

listitem.para: EPUB Canonical Fragment Identifiers (epubcfi) , which defines a standardized method for referencing arbitrary content within an EPUB Publication through the use of fragment identifiers.
Alternate Style Tags , which defines a pattern for tagging alternate style sheets using microformats.
